metadata.Title: CVE-2023-32211 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A type checking bug would have led to invalid code being compiled. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 113, Firefox ESR < 102.11, and Thunderbird < 102.11.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-32211` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmozjs-102-0 - 102.11.0-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:102.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: mozjs102 package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '102.11.0-0ubuntu0.22.10.1').
mozjs78 package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.10.1').
